intro: Agenium leptocladum, commonly known as the slender-leaved agenium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It is often found in coastal and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
